plot: Set in Canton, China in the 1940s, the story revolves in a town ruled by the Axe Gang, Sing who desperately wants to become a member. He stumbles into a slum ruled by eccentric landlords who turns out to be the greatest kung-fu masters in disguise. Sing's actions eventually cause the Axe Gang and the slumlords to engage in an explosive kung-fu battle. Only one side will win and only one hero will emerge as the greatest kung-fu master of all.

m.role: Badass Grandpa The Landlord and The Beast. Also contains a Real Life example: The Beast's actor Bruce Leung was about 55 when this movie was filmed. He did his own stunts. CGI had to assist where The Beast lifted his leg high for the earthquake stomp in the casino due to physical limitations, but otherwise it was all him. And by "limitations" we mean "he CAN perform an axe kick over his own head, but he can't HOLD his leg up there like in the shot."
Henpecked Husband: The landlord. He deserves it.

The landlord in Kung Fu Hustle. To be fair, she was mad at him because he was cheating on her. But not that she is ever nicer to anyone else. Though him and the landlady are in fact Happily Married. And both of them are kung fu experts.

f.role: Gag Boobs: Anytime the Landlady cranks up her sonic scream to attack level.
Never Mess with Granny: The Landlady, who just so happens to be made of awesome.

name: Kung Fu Hustle
